results.title: Youth of the world = Die Jungend der welt
results.creator_credit: UFA, Bavaria Film, Fox and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Documentary about the 1936 Winter Olympics in Germany - edited by Carl Junghans in a style which pre-figures Leni Riefenstahl’s approach to her film of the main Olympics.

results.title: Youth of the Nation
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Tara from Redan told this story because “…its my greatest expertise. I’m young, I’m surrounded by young people everyday and advocate on behalf of them so it makes sense”.

results.title: Youth of Japan
results.brief_description: Like young people everywhere, the youth of modern Japan display vision, hope and enthusiasm for life and strength of purpose. This is illustrated by impressions of the lives of a typical young factory worker, shop assistant and student.

results.title: Youth in freedom
results.brief_description: Deals with the various youth activities in Germany. Funds are provided annually by the government for youth organisations. We see young people at sporting grounds, on camping trips and in youth hostels.

results.title: Youth in Britain
results.brief_description: A film without commentary showing an imaginative picture of young people of all ages in Britain during the 1950s. Specially composed music by Lennox Berkeley accompanies scenes of babyhood, kindergarten, school and college life and recreation.

results.title: Youth club
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, Verity Films, Film Producers Guild and Norman Prouting
results.brief_description: An account of the activities of youth organisations in Britain and how they help young people to bridge the gap between school and adult life, told through the story of a boy who is persuaded to join a youth club and who quickly discovers the variety of interests which it has to offer.

results.title: Youth and music
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, ONF | NFB and Claude Jutra
results.brief_description: The National Gallery of Canada serves the Canadian public in many ways. This film tours the galleries in Ottawa where the national collection of old masters, as well as modern works, are on display. It shows how the Gallery helps foster art appreciation. Behind the scenes we see another phase of the work of art—the cleaning, preservation and storing of art treasures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Blais, ONF | NFB and Claude Jutra
